newsitem.title: AUSTRALIA: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - March 20.
newsitem.headline: RTRS-Australian Stocks to Watch Today - March 20.

text.p: Some Australian stocks to watch this morning:
The Australian-Anglo miner said overnight that it would take a one-off charge of US$40 million to cover the costs of reorganising its operations into six London and Australian-based units.

The Melbourne retailer of upmarket casual clothing and homewares on Thursday announced a slump in first half net profit to A$1.09 million from A$5.53 million. Sales also fell by about A$10 million to A$136.96 million.

Papua New Guinea-based gold and mining stocks are expected to remain volatile due to civil unrest over the controversial plan by Prime Minister Sir Julius Chan to use mercenaries on the island of Bougainville.
The two part-owners of the Optus Vision pay television network are close to selling their stakes to major shareholder Optus Communications Ltd, the Australian Financial Review newspaper said.

The Australian airline announced just before the close of Wednesday trade that it had sold its strategic stake in trans-Tasman rival Air New Zealand Ltd and would make a pre-tax profit of A$99 million. The end of the shareholding is expected to boost competition between the two international carriers.

The Australian onshore petroleum producer on Wednesday announced a major move into the offshore arena with the A$183 million purchase of WMC Ltd's stake in the East Spar field off the coast of Western Australia. The purchase will be funded by a rights issue, which raised the eyebrows of some analysts.
